wikipedia_page.main:
Sir Walter Vaughan Morgan, 1st Baronet (3 May 1831 – 12 November 1916), was a British businessman and the 578th Lord Mayor of London.
He was the sixth son of Thomas Morgan of Pipton, near Glasbury, Breconshire and his wife Elizabeth Vaughan. He served as Sheriff of London for 1900-01 and as Lord Mayor of London for 1905–05. In 1906 he was created a Baronet, of Whitehall Court in the City of Westminster.His youngest brother Octavius Vaughan Morgan, FSA (1837–96) was a Liberal MP for Battersea from 1885 until 1892.

link_mentions.page: List of lord mayors of London

response: * Sir Walter Morgan, 1st Baronet (1831–1916), British politician
*12 November - Sir Walter Morgan, 1st Baronet, banker and Lord Mayor of London, 85

The Morgan Baronetcy, of Whitehall Court in the City of Westminster, was created in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom 28 July 1906 for Walter Morgan, Lord Mayor of London from 1905 to 1906. The title became extinct on his death in 1916. Octavius Vaughan Morgan was the younger brother of Sir Walter Morgan, 1st Baronet.
